description.narrative: - The Project would enhance the Sponsor''s ability to further expand in a region with rising incidence of cancer. IFC''s investment addresses the low installed capacity issue contributing to modern oncology infrastructure in markets where some service providers operate old technology, lacking accuracy and effectiveness. - Medical Developers is expected to support the development of technically-qualified staff through training, careful management, regional cooperation and long-term planning. - The Project would also serve to promote higher standards in cancer care with demonstration and spillover effects in the private and public sectors. - The Project will improve local access to specialized treatments previously inaccessible or available only in developed markets.

The proposed investment consists of a senior loan of up to US$5 million equivalent to finance expansion of medical oncology services (primarily radiotherapy) in the Dominican Republic and Mexico. The Project funds will complement equity/lease financing (total project cost US$12.1m equivalent) that will help establish: (i) a new hospital-linked center in Dominican Republic (IFC Tranche A: US$2 million); and (ii) 2 free-standing centers in Mexico (IFC Tranche B: US$3 million equivalent peso-linked). The Project is aimed at supporting Medical Developers, a new IFC client with more than 30 years of experience and diversified operations throughout Latin America that focuses on providing a wide and most-advanced range of radiation therapy services for cancer treatment.
